programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Ivy battle it out at a locker auction in Lancaster, California, while Jarrod and Brandi buy some DJ equipment.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team scrutinises a 1547 edition of The Dance of Death, two sculptures from Dr Seuss' taxidermy collection, and a tear-gas baton.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a custom Fender quad reverb guitar, a vintage Wheaties box featuring Tonya Harding, and a pair of steelyard scales from the 1700s.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth plots to empty the overflowing warehouse behind Les's back, but risks upsetting his father.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth goes against Les's advice and buys an old Chevy sign at Detroit's annual Woodward Dream Cruise event and hopes that he has made the right decision.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team restores a 1940s X-ray machine, and a school teacher arrives with an 1880s mechanical apple corer.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team is presented with a rare 1950s British motorbike, before mending a 1940s penny scale.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: Barry Clifford and Scott Wolter learn the meaning behind one of the symbols on the prized metal ingot they think once belonged to Captain Kidd, leading them one step closer to a Templar-Pirate connection - and unearthing lost treasure.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The case of Teri Jo Bradish, who was found strangled in rural Wyoming in 1985. The 13-year-old had left a group home for troubled youth hours before she was killed. Her father - later convicted of her rape and murder - had hoped to collect $10,000 on a life insurance policy.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders have a mysterious new rival at an auction in the historical town of DeSoto, where a collection of Willie Nelson memorabilia is up for sale.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor manages to turn Bubba against Ricky at an auction in a wealthy suburb of Dallas.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team from UFO Magazine investigate investigates videos indicating a strong UFO surveillance presence at weapons laboratories.

programme.title: Ultimate Vehicles
programme.desc: The milestones of engineering that have changed land, water, and air transport for good, beginning with a look at ships that rule the waves.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus has his eye on a Citroen XM that looks amazing - but it's in France. Will isn't sure, but the engineering challenges win him over.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Danielle is set a stiff challenge, and Mike is desperate to buy a 1967 Ford Fairlane car.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit a farm in need of vital funds, before exploring a boarded-up cheese factory and an underground railroad site.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les faces a dilemma over the authenticity of a rare guitar and, with no expert on hand for advice, he is forced to go with his gut instinct.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley reacts to some bad manners in the shop queue, a kooky cowboy arrives at the counter and Rich makes an error that could cost him his job.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds are forced to take action when they witness a hustler scamming their customers in the car park. Plus, Seth and Ashley finally come to blows.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Kane Hodder, an actor who played Jason Voorhees in four of the Friday the 13th films, comes to American Jewelry to have a gold pendant featuring his trademark hockey goalie mask.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les and Ashley must properly determine the value of a shoddy bike. Meanwhile, Seth enters into a conflict with a New Jersey man, and a customer desires a TV.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth plots to empty the overflowing warehouse behind Les's back, but risks upsetting his father.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Two rare and huge GI Joe playsets are deployed to the shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A letter said to be signed by Napoleon makes Rick stand to attention. Other items under consideration include a surreal figure by Mexican artist Pedro Friedeberg, a 1960s Monkees talking puppet and original Dick & Jane illustrations.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1969 Triumph Motorcycle gets Rick's engine roaring, but it remains to be seen whether he will make an offer the buyer cannot refuse.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A set of 1814 naval history books from John Adams' personal library sails into the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Early Western film star Harry Carey's collection of nearly 200 celebrity autographs arrives at the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick gets a taste of British sweets when a Smarties dispenser is brought into the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team scrutinises a 1547 edition of The Dance of Death, two sculptures from Dr Seuss' taxidermy collection, and a tear-gas baton.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a custom Fender quad reverb guitar, a vintage Wheaties box featuring Tonya Harding, and a pair of steelyard scales from the 1700s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 19th-century sun dial cannon arrives at the shop, but it remains to be seen whether Rick will blast out the big bucks or if the deal will fizzle out.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1944 steel penny rolls into the shop, and the team also has a look at an 1850s calendar clock, an HR Giger lithograph from the film Alien 3, and a Smokey the Bear puppet.

programme.title: Mega Pit Stops
programme.desc: A look at how enormous vehicles, such as planes, trains and ships, are repaired and returned to service within incredibly short timeframe.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught On Camera
programme.sub-title: The World's Most Haunted School and More
programme.desc: The World's Most Haunted School and More.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Investigating freak cases of mass animal deaths and trying to discover why bee and bat populations are dramatically shrinking.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Rick and Marty Lagina find data that shows that large, metal objects are buried beneath Smith's Cove. They go on to make a surprising discovery.

programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: It’s all hands on deck as the divers work relentlessly to collect tonnes of urchin. But as the weather deteriorates, one of the crew gets a scare from below the surface..

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and finds out how much Jo Brand, John Sessions, Dara O Briain and regular panellist Alan Davies know about the topic of jumble, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis front a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring best bits and unseen material from the series.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the offbeat panel quiz and finds out how much Shappi Khorsandi, Ross Noble, Johnny Vegas and regular panellist Alan Davies know about the world of journalism, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and finds out how much Jo Brand, John Sessions, Dara O Briain and regular panellist Alan Davies know about the topic of jumble, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon, Clive Myrie, Sara Pascoe and Rick Edwards compete in Double Points Friday, and their scores are tallied from the week resulting in an overall champion being crowned.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis front a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring best bits and unseen material from the series.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle take downhill mountain-bike racing to the next level by adding more wheels.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are each challenged to find a classic car at auction for £3,000. Exploring whether they are more fun to drive than modern alternatives, the trio then take the vehicles to Majorca to compete in a rally. Jeremy also test-drives the BMW Z4 and Nissan 370Z, and AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori head to an airport storage and luggage auction to bid for the cast-offs of the rich and famous.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori head to an auction in Desert Hot Springs, California, and do their best to keep the competition at bay.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: The Pickers get a chance to peruse collector Mingo's stock of vintage Indian Trail and Harley Davidson motorcycles.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike bids for a 1940s motorcycle, while Danielle gets excited over a gun appraisal.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: James is called to a drunk driver who, in his inebriated state, has crashed his car into a parked vehicle at high speed, but the story takes a twist when his girlfriend arrives.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Rookie Bodycam Cop Laura heads out to make her first arrest as a newly qualified police officer and James is called to a disturbance on a quiet residential street.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A 999 call from a teenager sparks a race against time for Nadiene and volunteer Matt. When confronted with an aggressive man, the pair are forced to hit their emergency buttons.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers in Hidalgo are forced to close the bridge when it's stormed by dozens of asylum seekers trying to jump the queue of people waiting to seek refuge in the USA.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May are challenged to create a TV advert for Volkswagen, but soon fall out as James concentrates on detailed information on fuel economy and Jeremy wants something more exciting. Richard Hammond explores an alternative to Germanic sports saloons and tests the Vauxhall VXR8 Bathurst, and former US chat show host Jay Leno is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Engineer Ralph Hosier champions two teams of car lovers on their mission to design and build scrap vehicles capable of beating pro-driver Shane Lynch's supercar in a daring challenge. This time, they take on the iconic Lamborghini Huracan Performante in a handling head to head. Their mechanical ingenuity and driving skills are put to the ultimate test as they race against both the supercar and the clock.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Former deputy prime minister John Prescott, actress Rebecca Front and comedian Micky Flanagan join host Frank Skinner, making the case for their pet hates to be banished for ever. The trio's dislikes include goal celebrations, school ties, celebrity chefs, audience participation and other people's music.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Countdown presenter (and Apprentice sidekick) Nick Hewer squares off against his show's former maths whizz Carol Vorderman and comedian Rhod Gilbert, making the case with host Frank Skinner for their gripes and pet hates to be banished for ever. The trio's dislikes include train managers, camping, Facebook, golf, holidays and advertising slogans.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner welcomes Strictly Come Dancing head judge Len Goodman, actress and impressionist Ronni Ancona and quick-witted comic Tim Vine to discuss their pet hates, in the hope of having them banished to Room 101. Their gripes include cats in the garden, karaoke DJs, foreign food and small talk at parties.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy has her god-daughter dumped on her overnight, which wouldn't be so bad except the girl's stay coincides with her birthday - leaving the inexperienced guardian and her flatmate Lee struggling to come up with appropriate entertainment for a bunch of excited nine-year-olds. Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star, with a guest appearance by Paul Kaye (Game of Thrones).

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee manages to persuade Lucy to spend a long weekend on his dad's new boat, despite her inability to swim and lifelong fear of water. However, the vessel turns out to be not quite the sleek yacht they were expecting. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Bobby Ball and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee wants to create the perfect Christmas for Lucy, so he invites her to spend the holiday in a cosy old country house that used to belong to his dear, dead old aunt - and to make it a proper family get-together, he invites along her parents and dipsy friend Daisy. But the Christmas spirit is in short supply when Lucy discovers that the cottage has not been lived in for years - and it isn't long before they have sensed a spooky presence. Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix star in this festive special of the sitcom, with Bobby Ball, Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant. Festive edition from 2013.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis front a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring best bits and unseen material from the series.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis front a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring best bits and unseen material from the series.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Harewood hosts an extended edition of the current affairs quiz, with comedian Josh Widdicombe and Newsnight presenter Kirsty Wark joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's events.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A 1970s Bond Bug three-wheeler divides opinion among Mathewsons customers, while a retired engineer reluctantly auctions off his late father's treasured 60s Jaguar Mark 2.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind an abandoned Second World War aviation facility in Farnborough, a Soviet airbase in the Gobi Desert, and a disused furnace in Pittsburgh.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How German U-boats were used to disrupt the flow of goods from America across the Atlantic Ocean in an attempt to starve Britain into submission.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Millau Viaduct in South West France, which is the tallest bridge in the world and stretches two and a half kilometres over one of Europe's deepest valleys.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: This edition of the documentary series takes a look at the town of Sodom, which is thought to have existed in ancient Palestine.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the validity of the Bible's best-known stories. Two different theories about Moses' dramatic parting of the Red Sea are examined. The original Hebrew version of the Bible contains references to a 'reed sea' where it is thought the crossing may have occurred.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: The Earl of Erroll - Death in the Valley
programme.desc: Crimes involving members of royal families from around the globe, beginning with an earl shot dead in a hedonistic hideaway for colonial aristocrats in Kenya.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How some of our greatest railways have challenged engineering's finest minds in their efforts to conquer the planet's waterways, including a tunnel beneath the English Channel..

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system..

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering breakthroughs that allow trains to go faster than ever, including technology that allows the navigation of the winding mountains of Spain at speed..

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering that has overcome some of the greatest mountain ranges to create innovative railways, including a tunnel in the Swiss Alps and a zig-zag railway in Ecuador..

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Documentary examining the plants and animals that thrive in monsoon areas, narrated by Colin Salmon. Crested black macaques take advantage of an abundance of fruit, and maleo birds use the sun to incubate their eggs on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. On Java, locals climb volcanoes to offer live sacrifices in thanks for the peaks' help in precipitating rain and fertilising plants with ash. The frequent and heavy rains in Borneo have destroyed the soils, created fierce competition for scarce nutrients, and driven evolution to produce some curious creatures. The Rajah Brooke's pitcher encourages tree shrews to relieve themselves to obtain the substances it needs, while the Bornean red leech is capable of swallowing the giant blue earthworm in one gulp.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Exploring the relationship that has developed over thousands of years between the people who live in monsoon regions and the wildlife they share them with. In the rice paddies of Assam, India, farmers battle a herd of hungry elephants over their crops, while on the Philippine island of Palawan, near Borneo, people still hunt in the forest and live in caves for part of the year. The programme also looks at the impact of organised religion, meeting members of the Bishnoi sect who believe that all life is sacred and have even been known to lay down their lives to protect trees. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: Attenborough's Living Lights
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of bioluminescence, the often spectacular natural light produced by creatures including glow-worms, fireflies and plankton, using specially designed cameras, some fitted to a new generation of deep-sea submersibles and robots to record instances in the very deep ocean. The programme shows a millipede glowing on the forest floor in California, the mesmerising flashing light patterns of the synchronous firefly, the spooky glow of a rare dragon fish and luminous earth worms in France.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Documentary examining the plants and animals that thrive in monsoon areas, narrated by Colin Salmon. Crested black macaques take advantage of an abundance of fruit, and maleo birds use the sun to incubate their eggs on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. On Java, locals climb volcanoes to offer live sacrifices in thanks for the peaks' help in precipitating rain and fertilising plants with ash. The frequent and heavy rains in Borneo have destroyed the soils, created fierce competition for scarce nutrients, and driven evolution to produce some curious creatures. The Rajah Brooke's pitcher encourages tree shrews to relieve themselves to obtain the substances it needs, while the Bornean red leech is capable of swallowing the giant blue earthworm in one gulp.

programme.desc: Exploring the relationship that has developed over thousands of years between the people who live in monsoon regions and the wildlife they share them with. In the rice paddies of Assam, India, farmers battle a herd of hungry elephants over their crops, while on the Philippine island of Palawan, near Borneo, people still hunt in the forest and live in caves for part of the year. The programme also looks at the impact of organised religion, meeting members of the Bishnoi sect who believe that all life is sacred and have even been known to lay down their lives to protect trees. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: Attenborough's Living Lights
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of bioluminescence, the often spectacular natural light produced by creatures including glow-worms, fireflies and plankton, using specially designed cameras, some fitted to a new generation of deep-sea submersibles and robots to record instances in the very deep ocean. The programme shows a millipede glowing on the forest floor in California, the mesmerising flashing light patterns of the synchronous firefly, the spooky glow of a rare dragon fish and luminous earth worms in France.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Top of the Pops and The Old Grey Whistle Test, featuring Alice Cooper, New York Dolls, Peter Green, Queen, Robin Trower, John Martyn, Whitesnake, Joan Jett and Black Sabbath.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s, including Pete Townshend of the Who, acoustic numbers by Davy Graham and Ralph McTell, and the talents of Americans Nils Lofgren and Ted Nugent. Also featured are performances by the Faces, Chris Spedding, the Runaways, Judas Priest, ZZ Top and the Cate Brothers.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: The Duke of Edinburgh, in his capacity as Ranger of the Great Park, takes a tour of Windsor's grounds and points out the modifications he has made during his tenure, including a deer park and a farm shop selling local produce. He then competes in the Royal Horse Show, which also features Prince Harry. Meanwhile, the Prince of Wales and the Duchess of Cornwall host a special banquet for the Prince's Trust.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: The Royal Palace of Caserta near Naples, Italy, which was created by Luigi Vanvitelli and houses a silk factory that dates back to the 18th century and still functions to this day.

programme.title: David Jason: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: The actor flies into the heart of a volcano, gets a surprise in a drag-racing car, hits the road with an American trucker and takes to the skies in a vintage Second World War plane.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Jim investigates the murders of a Glasgow by-election candidate and her agent, who had been championing the return of capital punishment. However, the veteran detective finds himself hard-pressed to arrive at a quick solution to the crime. Elsewhere, a young woman is strangled by her stalker then raped. Robert Carlyle makes one of his earliest screen appearances, alongside star Mark McManusrs.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Legal action against Larry Cotter proves fruitless, so the sisters decide to take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor comes up against the governors of the East London Hospital when they threaten to take over the Thrift. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: The sleuthing monk defends a man accused of murdering a wealthy and powerful baron, with only a mysterious leper as his ally. Medieval drama, starring Derek Jacobi, Terence Hardiman, Michael Culver and Sarah Badel.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The police suspect Lovejoy of stealing from one of Jane's old friends, forcing him to enlist the help of refuse collector extraordinaire Brian Nun to clear himself. Unfortunately, matters are complicated by Eric's 'bin diving' habit. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Two mysterious murders appear to be the work of an ancient Mayan curse attached to a statue acquired by Lovejoy. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: General Wellesley receives unwanted reinforcements from the King of Spain in the form of the Royal Irish Company and Sharpe is charged with transforming them into an effective fighting unit. When Kiely learns his wife is pregnant, he sends her away out of harm's way, but she is captured. With Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley and Hugh Fraser.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Oz finds himself back in England after a night of heavy drinking - but has no idea how he got there. Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A spate of petty pilfering in the hut leads to fears that one of the lads may be a thief - and prompts Oz to come up with a novel way of catching the culprit. Classic comedy, starring Kevin Whately, Jimmy Nail and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: The Man in the Long Black Coat
programme.desc: Victor's continuing campaign against bureaucrats finds another victim - a health and safety inspector who comes to check on the compost heap at the bottom of the Meldrews' allotment. Christmas special from 1991, with guest star Eric Idle.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The grand opening of Pryde Castle ends in disaster when a guide is struck by an arrow, and Father Brown becomes convinced that the motive lies buried in the Pryde family's past. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.

credits.actor: Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Convicted killer Violet is given a temporary reprieve from the gallows, and begs Father Brown to help prove her innocence. However, with only three days in which to do it, he must try to find the real culprit before it's too late. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: As the Brokenwood Golf Club gathers for its Wednesday morning round, a zombie-like figure lurches from the morning mist identified as Alison Stone, the wealthy club owner. Her face red and blistering, she collapses into a bunker and dies leaving Mike and Kristin to investigate an apparent homicide by poisoning. Detective drama, starring Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Pana Hema Taylor and Nic Sampson.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: The Murdochs' housewarming party is cut short when a man is cooked to the point of exploding in a closet-sized microwave prototype. Return of the crime drama, starring Yannick Bisson.

programme.title: Frankie Drake Mysteries
programme.desc: When a magician's assistant is killed, Frankie goes undercover to find the culprit. But can she see clearly through the smoke and mirrors?.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Anna Westin, a troubled childhood friend of Wallander's daughter, visits his house late at night begging for his help - but disappears soon afterwards. Meanwhile, an elderly woman's burned body is found in a shallow grave, and when the detective discovers a connection between Anna and the murder victim, he fears she could be the next target of a dangerous religious fanatic. Linda returns to Ystad to help with the investigation, and has life-changing news for her father. Guest starring Lindsay Duncan (Rome), with Kenneth Branagh and Jeany Spark.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: An insight into how the minerals that are an essential ingredient in glass cookware are mined, and a look at how money is kept safe and secure inside cash machines.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a TVR Cerbera for £8,000, and Edd China works on restoring this classic sports car so it may be sold on for a profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini takes a Chrysler CG Imperial LeBaron Dual Cowl Phaeton to Kuwait's Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini enthuses about a 1931 Ford Model A Starlite coupe hot rod that won the Autoram as it goes under auction without a reserve.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: Dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A fire causes red-hot metal shrapnel to rain over Dallas, a motorcycle daredevil survives a 200mph crash and a car is thrown half a mile by a huge explosion.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A helicopter co-pilot fights for his life after a crash, a man loses control of his powerboat at 125mph and a tanker blaze soon becomes a fireball.

programme.title: Extreme Loggers
programme.desc: Lumberjack Joey Mills demonstrates traditional methods - cutting timber by hand, loading cumbersome logs with makeshift equipment and transporting them using mules.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: A woman requests the team's help in improving her boyfriend's 1967 Galaxie which has recently been neglected due to family problems.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: King Crab season kicks off with a 12 million pound Bairdi quota increase that causes a fishing frenzy. Plus, a boat is stolen the night before launch.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to San Francisco in search of a Chevrolet Stepside pick-up truck free from rust, but the one he finds still needs extensive restoration from Edd China.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a G Wagen, a popular German 4x4. Mechanic Edd China spruces it up with a 2012 front end and rear lights, but it may not be enough for them to turn a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to America in search of a Willys Jeep, but the vehicle he finds needs major repairs and high transport costs to the UK could jeopardise his making a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: A pickup truck is a stateside icon and Mike Brewer is keen to get into the booming classic truck market. He manages to find a 1950s Ford F-1, which is an unfinished project. mechanic Edd China creates a paint scheme based on a 'sandstorm in the desert'.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer seeks a challenge in the form of a 1970 Ford Bronco, which is riddled with rust. The project seems to be seconds from disaster, but Edd China keeps his cool.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Humvee to work on, and he and Edd China create a four-wheel-drive camping vehicle capable of venturing to places no camper has been before.

programme.title: Titanic: Anatomy of a Disaster
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the infamous 1912 tragedy. Advanced imaging techniques, computer animation, dramatic re-enactments and a dive to the wreckage site help reveal what caused the ship to sink - and what could have been done to prevent it.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife truckers Nick and Jo recover a 70-year-old war plane. Elsewhere, a delayed flight to an outback town threatens to leave a mobile heart clinic without a doctor.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The gang transforms an iconic 1973 Ford Bronco into a monster truck with attitude. Plus, Ant builds a bike for his most important client: his daughter.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: On a trip to Barcelona to buy antiques Drew Pritchard uncovers an early, two-door Range Rover. In Hampshire, he and Paul Cowland disagree on how to restore a Porsche 944.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a Cornish castle, Drew Pritchard digs out beach buckets and toy trucks. Later, his friend Stuart sells off his renowned collection of car memorabilia - and Drew has first dibs.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard is on a mission for quality, heading to a decorative antiques dealer in Royal Tunbridge Wells, Kent. In Dumfries, he seeks hidden treasure in a furniture collection.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, with matches including Derby County v Hull City, Queens Park Rangers v Leeds United and Bristol City v Barnsley.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton and Hus head to freezing Finland following a hot tip. Up near the Arctic Circle there's a kind of Winter Wonderland of Second World War vehicles and equipment..

programme.title: The Detectives: My Killer Case
programme.sub-title: Andrew Scanlan: Murder In The Woods
programme.desc: Disturbing crimes from across the UK are unpacked and retold in intimate detail through police files, CCTV footage and accounts from those who helped solve them.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The case of a man who staged his wife's suicide in a bid to cash in on her life insurance policy, but was caught out by modern forensic technology.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: How, in Litherland, Merseyside, 16-year-old Allan Bentley decided to copy the torturous and violent behaviour he saw in the film Reservoir Dogs to deal with his problems. In 1999, Bentley orchestrated the torture and murder of 15-year-old Michael Moss.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which a 21-year-old mother failed to return from night classes, before her car was found burned out. Investigators immediately suspected foul play, but no one was prepared for the web of lies that unravelled following her disappearance.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: When no murder weapon is found, FBI agents resort to working undercover to investigate a woman's disappearance.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Officers investigate when a Labrador is accused of biting two men, and wildlife experts fight to save the life of an injured owl.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown, set against the backdrop of the city's iconic beach.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Paralympic athlete Amy Purdy isn't afraid to take risks, such as waiting to find her dress just three weeks before the big day. Plus, Lori's wedding is just nine days ahead.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The death of the fiance's mother makes bride-to-be Amanda's dress fitting tough, as the consultant also knew the deceased and they had all planned to be present at the ceremony.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lori reaches her limit with the most disrespectful bridesmaids she has ever met, including some who try to put the bride off her dream dress.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A three-day-old kitten with a badly twisted leg needs a series of splints to save her, and female loggerhead turtles are in the midst of laying eggs, and some have begun to hatch.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: It is the turn of the Cook Islands to provide the cases, as Chris Brown handles a hit-and-run victim, a wolfhound with an eye problem and very mischievous goat called Brownie.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Self-described 'secret eater' Doug is managing to hide his snacking. However, his obesity is stopping him from living a full life with his wife, who is now demanding a change.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Maja moved to Houston to undertake a difficult weight-loss journey with the support of her boyfriend, Christian. However, when he abruptly left her, she discovered that the only person she could count on was herself.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Maja moved to Houston to undertake a difficult weight-loss journey with the support of her boyfriend, Christian. However, when he abruptly left her, she discovered that the only person she could count on was herself.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: With Reuben struggling to focus on his schoolwork and dump his sweets obsession, mum Vicky is at breaking point - so she gives him an ultimatum.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: Reuben takes his father Matthew with him on his first big business trip to New York. A shoot with a top photographer means the pressure is on for Reuben to impress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Country singer Jerrod Niemann's fiancee visits the shop, and the mother of another customer is determined to see her daughter in white.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride who chose to elope tries to make peace with her parents by involving them in her choice of dress. Another customer wants a gown fit for a queen.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride wants a look inspired by her favourite singer, and another customer finds her ideas being undermined by her opinionated entourage.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A father and fiance have very different ideas about a bride's dress, and a customer wants a simple gown while her family favour something more spectacular.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Two customers want to wear fancy dresses for their big days - but the mother of one and the brother of the other have different ideas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: With just weeks until her big day, Lisa has brought her opinionated fiance to the store. Plus, Christina's long-distance engagement has left her friends weary.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: After a horrific accident, Katie was told that thanks to a terrible injury she would never walk again. Unwilling to accept her fate, she is determined to walk down the aisle in her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: WNBA star Glory Johnson brings her fiance WNBA player Brittney Griner to help find a wedding dress. However, it's not all fun and games for Glory as the pressure rises.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo performs readings for family members of firefighters and police officers who were killed in the line of duty.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo helps people to contact their dead parents in the hope of gaining approval for their current relationships - but blessings from the other side may not be forthcoming.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Customers bring their sceptical relative to see Theresa Caputo in the hope that she can convince them her abilities are real.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: Beverly's clutter has filled every inch of her home, and her dogs have made part of the house uninhabitable. Now she faces clearing her hoard or losing it all.

programme.title: Murder By Numbers
programme.desc: A case from Alexandria, Virginia, which saw the fatal shooting of a sheriff's wife at her front door. The community buzzed with theories as more citizens were shot at their doors, leaving everyone wondering who could be next.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The phenomenon of high-profile criminal cases where people publically feign innocence about a crime they have committed, shedding crocodile tears in the process.

programme.title: Inside Death Row with Trevor McDonald
programme.desc: Part two of two. The broadcaster interviews Fredrick Baer, who is awaiting execution at Indiana State Prison for the murders of a woman and her four-year-old daughter. Baer talks about his abusive childhood and explains what led him to a life of crime, before Trevor visits the chamber where the condemned man will one day be executed. There's also an insight into the more privileged part of the facility, where inmates stay in a dormitory with cubicles instead of cells. There, he talks to John Serwatka, who was paid to kill two innocent strangers and will never be released.
